snippet: Kim Davis has asked a federal appeals court to scrap a series of rulings issued by the district judge who sent her to jail for refusing to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.
abstract: Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis asks federal appeals court to discard rulings by Judge David L Bunning, who sent her to jail for continued refusal to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples in Kentucky.
lead_paragraph: Kim Davis has asked a federal appeals court to scrap a series of rulings issued by the district judge who sent her to jail for refusing to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.

headline.main: Kentucky: Clerk Who Defied Order Seeks Reversal of Rulings on Marriage
headline.print_headline: Kentucky: Clerk Who Defied Order Seeks Reversal of Rulings on Marriage

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
